page.title: 03FORESTRY COMMISSION:GARTMORE
page.content: To the north of Gartmore is the{Queen {Elizabeth Forest,}where Sitka Spruce is grown because of the thin acid peats and high rainfall. Trees are planted at about 2000 per hectare and thinned after 20 years and then every 5 years until they are 45 years old, when all are cut down. The top 20% of wood goes to Cowie to make{chipboard, the rest going to the saw-mill for house building. Soon "Forwarders" and "Processors" will cut and load the timber instead of woodcutters and even now helicopters are used to spray insecticide and foam on forest fires. {Visitors}are encouraged to use the forest trails and camp sites. {Gartrenich and Flanders Mosses}have 14-20 year old Lodge-pole Pine trees but no one knows how they will be cut as machinery sinks into the 10m deep peat.
